Articles.Content:
O'k so I need a heavy lifter that can get a 750 ton armored space ship out of kerbals orbit does what I want even exist or do I need hyper edit? Also I posted a thread about a 450 ton lifter yesterday but today I build a bigger one.

Edited December 24, 2013 by daniel_stephen
Armored what kind of parts are you using heavy orange tanks or something else
Those 2x2 plates It has 8 orange fuel tanks and 300+ 2x2 plates
HAVE YOU THOUGHT OF SENDING IT UP IN PARTS AND USE DOCKING PORTS? IT WOULD REDUCE LAG AND MAKE LAUNCHING IT EASIER.....oh sry about caps:blush:
It has 350+ 2x2 panels and 6 orange fuel tanks

The easiest way is to "cheat" it into space. (You don't need hyper edit) Just take a look at This tutorial and what you want to do is launch a placeholder craft (To get the orbital info you need) then launch your gigantor ship and quicksave. Then just replace the orbital info of your ship with that of the placeholder don't forget to change the following

 sit = ORBITING
			landed = False
			landedAt =

to the indicated values.
Check out this thread. The last post mentioned getting 2600 tons to orbit.

Check out this thread. The last post mentioned getting 2600 tons to orbit.
With no payload, it reached orbit with about 1300 tons of fuel remaining, for a weight of 2634 tons. It can safely handle a payload of 800-900 tons and still reach a circular orbit with almost dry tanks

Yeah, not quite.

To daniel_stephen:

I think - I hope - that you will find the denizens of this forum helpful and supportive in your Kerbal escapades. I don't know how much effort you've put into it, but as a sign of good faith I think you should put in a little more. Instead of saying "build me a lifter" maybe you could try asking "how can I build a lifter." A genuine willingness to put the effort in goes a long way.

Or if effort isn't your thing, just use Hyperedit :/

=Smidge=
